title: NYC parties hosted by Sarah Jessica Parker, designer Naeem Khan and more
text:
The old saying is true, New York is the city that never sleeps.

On any given night there is a fashionable fete at the hottest new venue with an A-list crowd.

Sarah Jessica Parker, 42nd President of the United States Bill Clinton and world-renowned fashion designer Naem Khan all attended stellar soirees in The Big Apple recently. FEMAIL reveals all the details, just in case your invite got lost in the mail.

PRODUCT LAUNCH

NYC icon: To celebrate the launch of Sarah Jessica Parker’s new Sauvignon Blanc wine 'Invivo X, Sarah Jessica Parker' an intimate party was held at The Garden Bar in Manhattan's South Street Seaport

A-list crowd: Sarah's husband Matthew Broderick and her good friend Andy Cohen were both at the stylish soiree

To celebrate the launch of Sarah Jessica Parker’s new Sauvignon Blanc wine 'Invivo X, Sarah Jessica Parker' an intimate party was held at The Garden Bar in Manhattan's South Street Seaport.

This marks the actress / entrepreneur’s first wine to launch from her new collection with the New Zealand-based brand.

'I’ve been so looking forward to releasing my Invivo X, Sarah Jessica Parker Sauvignon Blanc and sharing it with the world,' said the Sex and The City star.

Sarah's husband Matthew Broderick and her good friend Andy Cohen were both at the stylish outdoor soiree.

As one would expect, SJP was instrumental in both naming the wine and designing the label.

Business partner: The Sauvignon Blanc was perfected in May 2019 during a 3-hour blending session in NYC with Sarah Jessica Parker and Invivo’s co-founders Rob Cameron & Tim Lightbourne

Coordination: She hand-painted the X on the original label and found the teal paint to match the exact shade of one of her favorite satin shoe colorways, 'Hamilton', from her SJP Collection label

The X and the comma directly after it, is an intentional and personal touch, referencing her signature email and Instagram post signoff: 'X, SJ.'

She hand-painted the X on the original label and found the teal paint to match the exact shade of one of her favorite satin shoe colorways, 'Hamilton', from her SJP Collection label.

In theme, the fashionista dressed to impress in a blue lace long-sleeve dress.

Guests went home with a bottle of wine and a handmade piece of jewelry from New Zealand-based label Lindi Kingi's 'Chaos of Stars' collection.

Lindi's architectural design style is influenced by issues of special importance and a desire to empower and connect women.

The Chaos Of The Stars Collection Stardust Earrings by Lindi Kingi, $140; queenofthefoxes.com

The Chaos of The Stars Collection The North Star Necklace, $120; queenofthefoxes.com

HUMANITARIAN EFFORT

So stylish: Floral was the fashion trend of the evening with DailyMailTV's Alicia Quarles wearing an A-line creme dress featuring red blossoms by Samantha Sung. Pictured with Naeem Khan

Party for a cause: New York-based fashion designer Naeem Khan hosted the Alzheimer’s Association Fall Benefit Cocktail Party. Pictured with Harold Koda, Aiana Dadanova

New York-based fashion designer Naeem Khan hosted the Alzheimer’s Association Fall Benefit Cocktail Party.

Guests included a group of New York’s finest, including DailyMailTV's Alicia Quarles, Princess Yasmin Aga Khan (daughter of Rita Hayworth), Diandra de Morrell Douglas, Robin Meltzer, Michele Herbert and former Curator of The Costume Institute Harold Koda.

Floral was the fashion trend of the evening with beautiful Alicia wearing an A-line creme dress featuring red blossoms by Samantha Sung.

Aiana Dadanova get in on the look in a flower-patterned one-shoulder jumpsuit.

The fashionable fete took place at the Zaha Hadid building in Chelsea to kick-off a reimagined Rita Hayworth Gala.

Cool venue: Guests mingled while taking in the stunning, architectural indoor and outdoor space

Naeem has been a longtime supporter of the Alzheimer’s Association.

Princess Yasmin Aga Khan, daughter of Rita Hayworth and the gala’s founder and general chair, thanked the world-renowned designer for his longtime friendship and encouraged guests to continue the amazing legacy of her mother by joining the fight to end Alzheimer’s disease.

The fall benefit will take place on October 22, 2019 at the iconic Rainbow Room to raise critical funds for Alzheimer’s Association care, support and research programs.

SAVING THE PLANET

Save the planet: An A-list crowd including Diane Lane gathered at the iconic Rainbow Room in Rockefeller Center to celebrate and support the oceans

There's no venue more fashionable than Rockefeller Center’s Rainbow Room.

An A-list crowd gathered at the iconic New York City landmark to celebrate and support the oceans.

Former President Bill Clinton, actor and Oceana Board of Directors Vice Chair Ted Danson and Oscar-nominated actress Diane Lane were all in attendance.

Diane and Simon Sidamon-Eristoff were honored for their commitment to safeguarding and revitalizing our world’s oceans.

While most guests fittingly wore blue, the 'Unfaithful' star stood out in a dynamite black dress with cascading gold embellishments at the neckline.

Bill Clinton spoke about Oceana’s effectiveness on behalf of oceans. 'I like Oceana because they’re old fashioned. When they say they’re going to get something done, they do.'

Elite: Andrew Sharpless, President Bill Clinton and Ted Danson attended the gala honoring Diane Lane and Simon Sidamon-Eristoff

Make a change: 'We have a massive global plastic pollution problem on our hands,' said Oceana board member Susan Rockefeller, who hosted the event along with her husband and fellow Oceana board member, David Rockefeller, Jr.

Diane spoke about the threats our oceans are facing today and said 'I’m deeply honored to be a part of Oceana’s mission to save our precious one-and-only blue planet.'

This year’s glamorous benefit focused on the crisis of plastic in the sea and launched Oceana’s global plastics campaign.

'We have a massive global plastic pollution problem on our hands,' said Oceana board member Susan Rockefeller, who hosted the event along with her husband and fellow Oceana board member, David Rockefeller, Jr.

Additional guests included Oceana board member and actor Sam Waterston, professional surfer Kai Lenny, cinematographer and director Reed Morano, and model and entrepreneur Sophia Hutchins.

The evening concluded with a live musical performance by Rakiem Walker Project, a 6-piece band led by saxophonist Rakiem Walker.

The event raised $1.9 Million for Ocean Conservation.
description: On any given night there is a fashionable fete at the hottest new venue with an A-list crowd in NYC. FEMAIL rounds up recent soirees attended by Sarah Jessica Parker, Bill Clinton and more.
